chargeHist.descr: Deliver Heroin within 1000 feet of school (<3g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittney A. BROZEK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Joint and several with Logan Daly. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No association with any known drug dealers or users.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant is to use only one doctor to prescribe medications and only one pharmacist to dispense medications, unless approved by the agent.

No association with any kinown drug dealers or users.

Participant gives presentation on how not being honest has resulted in her almost losing the Drug Court opportunity.
Despite all of the consequences she endured during her possible termination, nothing was as bad as potentially losing her freedom and everything she worked so hard for.
Things are going overall.  Keeping herself on path to complete program.
Paperwork in order.

Clean and Sober.  Coin.
Last Chance Agreement.  Next week Participant will present to Court how her lack of honesty almost had her removed from program.
Paperwork will need work given the past week.  
Adjourned:  9:42 a.m.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2020 at 09:00 am.

09:10 AM Attorney Jacalyn Labre in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brittney A. Brozek in court, in custody, represented by her attorney, Ralph Sczygelski.
A motion was filed for termination of Defendant's involvement in the Manitowoc County Drug Court Program.  Parties stipulated to the facts in the motion, as well as completion of three phases of the treatment program.  
Court explains the rights she is giving up by stipulated to these facts.  9:13 a.m. State presents its reasons for termination.  State rests at 9:16 a.m.  Attorney Sczgelski makes his arguments against termination, including her progress in the program, continued employment and academic success.  Request made for a Last Chance Agreement.  Defense rests 9:20 a.m.  Defendant makes statement.  Rests 9:27 a.m.  Court renders its decision, allowing Defendant to remain in the Drug Court Program on a Last Chance Agreement. Specific conditions of that agreement include:  Restarting at Phase 4.  Defendant is to abstain from possessing/consuming any alcohol whatsover.  Defendant is to prepare and present to the drug court in 2 weeks the importance of honesty in this program.  Defendant is ordered to return to drug court tomorrow, January 15, 2020 at 9:00 a.m. in Branch I.  
Last Chance Agreement to be drafted and signed by the Defendant before Court tomorrow.  
Adjourned:  9:51 a.m. 
  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for January 15, 2020 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion for Termination from Drug Court.

Order for Court Imposed Sanction.
The Court, on its own motion, orders a change in the conditiuons of the defendant's probatoin.  The defendant will be held in the Manitowoc County Jail until further order of this court.

Minutes.
Jewel Scharenbroch, Public Defender.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Order Modifying Sentence.
It is ordered that the defendant may be released to DOC on November 26, 2014 for transport to TCI for treatment.  Upon completion of treatment, her conditional time is stayed per previous signed amendment dated November 13, 2014.
Copy delivered to jail.

It is hereby ordered that Brittney Brozek be transported to Taycheedah Correctional Institution on November 26, 2014 to allow her to participate in the AODA program which is scheduled to begin on December 4, 2014.

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction ordering a stay of Ms. Brozek's conditional jail time upon completion of her AODA program at TCI.
Cover letter.

Order for Modifying Defendant's Bail.
It is hereby ordered that the above captioned defendant's bail be modified from $1,000 cash to $1,000 Personal Recognizance Bond with the following additional conditions.  The defendant will maintain absolute sobriety.  The defendant will report to the Manitowoc County Jail every day by 5:00 p.m  All other conditions remain the same.

Minutes.
RE:  Possess Heroin within 1000 feet of school, on 02-27-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts deliver heroin within 1000 feet of a school.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 04-28-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash with the conditions that she have no contact with Logan M.W. Daly or Kamuel I. Maiola.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
